results.title: Louisbourg
results.creator_credit: Tom Daly, ONF | NFB and Albert Kish
results.brief_description: Shows the restoration of the Fortress of Louisbourg on Cape Breton Island. The fort, originally built by King Louis XV to protect French possessions in the French Colonial era, is considered to be the largest historical site and dig in North America. A methodological film showing techniques of research involved in reconstructing some of the main buildings.

results.title: Louis James hates school
results.creator_credit: Learning Corporation of America and Paul Fillinger
results.brief_description: Louis James hated school, and never learned to read or spell. All he wanted to do was get a job and make a lot of money. Into the rubbish bin went his books and he headed to town to find a job. He applied as a pilot for a skywriting company but he soon found that his spelling mistakes were too big and too apparent. His job hunting went from the embarrassingly bad to the horrendous as the determined dropout discovers for himself the real value of reading and spelling, whether in school or out. Animated film.

results.title: Louis IX, Roi, Chevalier et Saint = Louis IX, king, knight and saint
results.brief_description:
The eve of the XIIIth century marks the revival of royal power. In France, Louis IX models himself on Charlemagne and, just like his illustrious predecessor, has a chapel, La Sainte Chapelle, built to symbolise his authority and his role as a intermediary between man and God. During this period, Saint Louis participates in two Crusades in the Orient. Although a failure, the Crusades reveal to the Europeans a world much wider and more diverse than they ever imagined. With better boats, stirring and maps, Europeans are able to set off to far flung parts of the globe and bring back marvellous tales and exotic products. This is a time of discovery and optimism, reflected in a certain estheticism in art and where the beautiful primes over the demonstrative. The XIIIth century sees the creative impulse shift from France to Italy with its soaring class of merchants and bankers.

Credits: Director, Roland Darbois ; writers, Roger Stephane, Roland Darbois, photography, Roland Dantigny.
Cast: Narrated by Georges Duby.

results.title: Lotu
results.brief_description: Life in New Guinea today, shows efforts towards a self-determination. The story of Saimon Gaius, a survivor of the Japanese invasion, now a Methodist minister as he works among his people. Photography by Keith Gow.

results.title: Lottie Lyell
results.creator_credit: Ben Lewin, Pamela Vanneck, Ron Saunders and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Willesee’s Australians”.
This moving drama series on important figures from Australia’s past brings Australian history to life. Lottie Lyell was one of Australia’s most successful actresses. Although she often played the damsel in distress in her early films, Lottie was no helpless heroine in real life. As well as starring in her films, she worked behind the cameras as script writer, art director, costume designer, editor and business manager. She was part of an excellent team with Raymond Longford, Australia’s best known silent film director with whom she had a long and enduring relationship.

results.title: Lotte Reiniger Compilation
results.brief_description: A compilation of works by silhouette animator Lotte Reiniger. “Carmen” Carmen entices the soldier, Don Jose, to the gypsy encampment where she steals his clothes. “Aladdin and the Magic Lamp” - The Arabian Nights story of Aladdin. “Gallant Little Tailor” - A little tailor, plagued by flies kills seven of them at one stroke . “Grasshopper and the Ant” - The grasshopper plays his fiddle all summer, but when winter comes he realises his error. Jack and the Beanstalk” - Traditional fairytale. “Little Chimney Sweep - Fairytale about a little chimney sweep. “Papageno” - From Mozart’s “Magic Flute”. “Puss in Boots”. “Snow White and Rose Red” - Snow White and Rose Red befriend a bear who later claims to be a prince under a spell.

results.title: Lothersdale: an image of England
results.creator_credit: Patricia Meehan and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Looks at Lothersdale, an epitome of England, and examines the life and work of this village. The mill and other industries are viewed, while the economic problems of farmers are examined.

results.title: Lost wax memory
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
Phillip Piperides, an Australian Cypriot is a sculptor in bronze. He explains the lost wax process of casting in bronze and explains the appeal of this particular form of sculpture. Shows examples of his work in Brisbane.
